title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: When attempting to rename a package, the system doesn't check if all resources within the package are writeable. This can lead to unexpected exceptions during the renaming process.
OB: The current implementation of package renaming does not verify the write permissions for all resources contained within the package.
EB: Precondition checking should be added to ensure that all files within the package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, perform the following steps:

1. Create a new package with a class unit (CU) in it.
2. Set the CU to read-only.
3. Attempt to rename the package.

Expected behavior: The package renaming process should complete successfully.

Actual behavior: An unexpected exception dialog is displayed after the renaming process finishes.
